# resignCurrent()

**Instance Method**

Restores the previous progress object to become the current progress object on the thread.

## Declaration

```swift
func resignCurrent()
```

## Discussion

This method restores the current progress object to what it was before invoking [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress/becomeCurrent(withPendingUnitCount:)].

Use this method after building your tree of progress objects, as [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Progress#Reporting-Progress-for-Multiple-Operations] describes.

## Accessing the Current Progress Object

- **current()**: Returns the progress instance, if any.
- **becomeCurrent(withPendingUnitCount:)**: Sets the progress object as the current object of the current thread, and assigns the amount of work for the next suboperation progress object to perform.
- **addChild(_:withPendingUnitCount:)**: Adds a process object as a suboperation of a progress tree.
- **performAsCurrent(withPendingUnitCount:using:)**: Retrieves the current thread’s progress object, executes the specified block, and increments the progress object by the specified units of work.
